RainbruRPG::Gui::ConnectionPanel

RainbruRPG::Gui::ConnectionPanel Class Reference

#include <connectionpanel.h>

Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Gui::ConnectionPanel:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

The netFlooder connection panel.

It shows a table containing the server list. The user can select a server to flood.

This panel send message telling to the sender to switch to the WaitingPanel and launching connection. The sender and ID are set in the constructor.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

The enumeration defining the Fox selectors, used in event mechanism.

Enumerator:
ID_NYI  Not Yet Implemented Identifier.
ID_BTN_REFRESH  The refresh button identifier.
ID_BTN_CONNECT  The connect button identifier.
ID_TABLE  The server table identifier.
ID_LAST  Setting the new value to FXMainWindow::ID_LAST.

The constructor.

The parent must not be NULL. The sender and id are used to send FOX signals.

void RainbruRPG::Gui::ConnectionPanel::createTableHeader (  )  [private]

Creates the table's column headers.

This method must be called in refresh() because the table->clearItems() call also delete column headers.

Definition at line 161 of file connectionpanel.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Gui::ConnectionPanel::feedTable (  )  [private]

The method feeding the account table.

It uses the tServerList retrived from xmlServerList serverList. It also calls setServerNumber(unsigned int) to change the total server number label.

Definition at line 137 of file connectionpanel.cpp.

FXString RainbruRPG::Gui::ConnectionPanel::getSelectedServerName (  )  [private]

Returns the name of the currently selected server.

It takes from the FXTable of server the selected row, and from this row number get the server's name.

See also:
selServer, onTableSelectionChange
Returns:
The selected server's name or "" if none selected
